Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; cream slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with added red centres above two white lines; exterior: narrow black band on top of rim; broken maeander pattern between pairs of dilute lines; below, painted decoration consisting of lion (neck, red mane and ear remaining) to left. Traces of glue at the left edge.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (according to Ashmolean Museum register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 292, no. 905, pl. 121)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 82, no. 14, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1217) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
